documentType: Bureau of Prisons incident report and memoranda
summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons forms and memoranda detailing the discovery, medical response, and aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death by suicide via hanging in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, on August 10, 2019. It includes the official Form 583 Report of Incident, staff memoranda describing the event, medical records, and unit rosters. This document appears to be a heavily redacted or coded log, possibly from a correctional facility or detention center, containing numerous unit designations, officer codes, and timestamps. The content is highly fragmented and lacks coherent narrative text, names, or clear events related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell (9 South SHU, cell #220) at approximately 6:33 a.m. Staff performed CPR. He was transported to Health Services and then via EMS to New York Presbyterian - Lower Manhattan Hospital, where he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. The report lists the incident as 'Inmate Death' with method 'Hanging/Asphyxiation'.

events.title: Body Alarm and Medical Response
events.description: A body alarm was activated in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at 6:33 a.m. Staff responded, began CPR, called EMS, and transported Epstein to the medical area and subsequently to an outside hospital.

events.title: Remains Transported to Morgue
events.description: Following his death at the hospital, Epstein's remains were moved to the hospital morgue and later transported by the Office of the City Medical Examiner (OCME) to the city morgue.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York (MCC NY)
New York Presbyterian - Lower Manhattan Hospital
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 a.m.
The official Bureau of Prisons Form 583 classifies the incident as an 'Inmate Death' with the method listed as 'Hanging/Asphyxiation'.
Medical staff noted 'circumferential bruising around the neck' upon finding Epstein.
Epstein was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. at New York Presbyterian - Lower Manhattan Hospital after efforts at resuscitation failed.
A lieutenant instructed escorting staff 'not to speak to anyone and or the media in regards to the situation,' directing inquiries to the MCC NY Public Relations Officer.
The document is a highly fragmented log with coded entries, timestamps, and unit designations.
